Posts.Content: Hi, sound like we have the same story. I had breast cancer recurrance after 9 years as well. I was told I had a problem with my discs when all along it was cancer in the spine. I took six months of pain before they figured it out. So, here I am with metastatic breast cancer to bones and lungs, stage 4. However, I have been surviving stage 4 since 2004. Yes, it is a nightmare to begin the journey again. I had chemo the first time. I am not doing it this time. I have been managing with femera and zometa. Now I am taking aromasin.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Springflower! I also have stage 4 cancer. Stay strong, I pray for you. I am 46 and not ready to give up either. I also have been misdiagnosed and here we are. I have lost faith in the medical establishment. I just try to help myself.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I also recommend a book, a must read for breast cancer. It is really inspiring and will give all stage 4 BC. a glimmer of hope. "A Cancer Battle Plan" by Ann Frahm
Posts.Title: Great Book

Posts.Content: First, I want to say that I am very happy for you. It seems that the media and society looks at a person with stage 4 cancer as being at death's door. I am happy to hear that more and more people are living longer. I have had stage 4 breast cancer since 2004. However, I rely very heavy on Alternative medicine. I had 5 weeks of radiation, but no chemo. I also try to stay positive, live healthy, take supplements and use holistic healing to strenghten my immune system and detoxify my body.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Amen!!!!! Thank you for your encouragement! I agree with you 100%. I have also met and fired doctors who had no interest in supporting me. I too do what makes sense. My best to you as well. We can beat this thing!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Sorry, I posted cancer info, and forgot to give the website. "hope for cancer " (no spaces). com  Good information!
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer info

Posts.Content: Here is an interesting site for anyone battling cancer. Even if you don't believe in alternative medicine, you can read about research and how to stay healthy during traditional treatment. I am currently using the products and have used them in 2004 with great success. ( I am not selling anything nor do I make commission of anyone who buys. This is just information I would like to share). Be well,
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer info

Posts.Content: Sorry, I forgot to actually list the site. Here it is :www.hopeforcancer.com
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer info

Posts.Content: Hi Ann, I am taking both. I had a cancerous lump in my breast in 2004. It was about 2 cm in diameter. I started taking large doses of Ellagic and drank Essiac tea every day. It took about 2 weeks and I felt the lump feeling softer, and the pain in my chest go away. After 2 months the lump was gone entirely. I chose not to do radiation or chemo. The lump never returned, but I did have a recurrence of cancer last year in my spine. I am now back on ellagic and essiac and will have Pet scan to see results in July.
Posts.Title: Ellagic Acid and Essiac
